title: Proquad Vaccine
author: Staff
description: ProQuad (MMRV) vaccine is a combined, attenuated, live virus vaccine containing measles, mumps, rubella, and includes varicella (MMRV) viruses.
cleaned_text: Virus Vaccine Live combined, attenuated, live virus vaccine containing measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella viruses. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), [combined](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/parents/why-vaccinate/combination-vaccines.html) vaccines merge equivalent component vaccines into single products to prevent more than one disease or protect against multiple strains of infectious agents causing the same disease. ProQuad [indicated](https://www.merck.com/news/us-fda-approves-intramuscular-administration-for-mercks-mmrv-family-of-vaccines-m-m-rii-measles-mumps-and-rubella-virus-vaccine-live-varivax-varicella-virus-vaccine-live-and-proquad/) for active immunization for the prevention of MMRV in children 12 months through 12 years of age. Antibody persistence rates one year after a single dose of [Proquad](https://www.merckvaccines.com/proquad/) were 98.9% against measles, and 97.5% against chickenpox. These persistence rates are similar to those observed at one year with the [M-M-R II](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/vaccines/m-m-r-ii-vaccine) vaccine. However, because a limited proportion mumps, and rubella (MMR) or varicella vaccinees fail to respond to one dose, a second dose is recommended to provide another opportunity to develop immunity. Of those who do not respond to the first dose of the measles component of MMR or varicella vaccine, 97%-99% [respond to a second dose](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/acip-recs/general-recs/timing.html). The [intramuscular](https://www.merck.com/news/us-fda-approves-intramuscular-administration-for-mercks-mmrv-family-of-vaccines-m-m-rii-measles-mumps-and-rubella-virus-vaccine-live-varivax-varicella-virus-vaccine-live-and-proquad/) route of administration for Proquad was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on March 6, 2023, as well as the European Union. The [ FDA](https://www.fda.gov/media/142224/download) approved the draft package insert labeling submitted under amendment #2, dated September 15, 2020. [Supplemental Update](https://www.fda.gov/media/147579/download) on April 13, 2021. And then [updated](https://www.fda.gov/vaccines-blood-biologics/vaccines/proquad) on April 16, 2021. The Initial Approval is a global research-driven pharmaceutical company dedicated to putting patients first, established in 1891. Proquad Indications Merck's [ProQuad](https://www.fda.gov/media/147560/download) is a vaccine indicated for active immunization to prevent measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella in children 12 months through 12 years of age. Proquad should not be administered to individuals with certain medical conditions, including blood dyscrasias, leukemia, lymphomas of any type, other malignant neoplasms affecting the bone marrow or lymphatic system, or individuals with any immunodeficient condition or receiving immunosuppressive therapy. Proquad also not be used in individuals with active untreated tuberculosis or active febrile illness with a fever (> 101.3 degrees F) or [pregnant women](https://www.fda.gov/media/75195/download). Pregnancy: ProQuad is [contraindicated](https://www.merckvaccines.com/proquad/clinical-data/efficacy/) for use in pregnant women. Do not administer ProQuad to women planning to become pregnant in the next three months. Because of the importance of rubella and varicella immunity among women of childbearing age, the postpartum vaccination of women without evidence of immunity to rubella or varicella with MMR, varicella, or MMRV vaccines should not be delayed because of receipt of anti-Rho(D) globulin or any other blood product during the last trimester of pregnancy or at delivery, says the [CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/acip-recs/general-recs/timing.html). AU TGA pregnancy category [B2](https://www.aci.health.nsw.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0007/273931/drug-safety-in-pregnancy.pdf): Drugs that have been taken by only a limited number of pregnant women and women of childbearing age, without an increase in the frequency of malformation or other direct or indirect harmful effects on the human fetus having been observed. Studies in animals are inadequate or lacking, but available data show no evidence of an increased occurrence of fetal damage. Proquad Dosage The CDC published updated [vaccination schedules](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/index.html) for 2022 on Feb. 17, 2022. Each 0.5-mL dose of ProQuad is administered [subcutaneously](https://www.merckvaccines.com/proquad/dosing-administration/). The first dose is usually administered at 12 to 15 months of age but can be given anytime through 12 years of age. If the [second dose](https://www.fda.gov/media/75195/download) of measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine is needed, ProQuad may be used. This dose is usually administered at 4 to 6 years of age. At least one month should elapse between a dose of a measles-containing vaccine, such as M-M-R II. The third dose of MMR might be recommended in [certain mumps](https://www.fda.gov/media/75195/download) outbreak situations. However, at least three months should elapse between a dose of varicella-containing vaccine and ProQuad. Proquad Side effects The following [cautions](https://www.merck.com/product/usa/pi_circulars/p/proquad/proquad_pi_4171.pdf) have been reported ProQuad: fever, injection-site reactions (pain/tenderness/soreness, erythema, and swelling); irritability; and rash on the body or at the injection site. In addition, systemic vaccine-related adverse events reported at a significantly greater rate in recipients of ProQuad than in recipients of the component vaccines administered concomitantly were fever and measles-like rash. Hypersensitivity: ProQuad is contraindicated in patients with a history of [anaphylactic reaction](https://www.merckvaccines.com/proquad/clinical-data/efficacy/) or hypersensitivity to any vaccine component (including gelatin or neomycin) or an initial dose of measles mumps, rubella, or varicella-containing vaccine. Use caution when administering ProQuad to individuals with anaphylaxis or immediate hypersensitivity to eggs. Proquad Vaccine News 2023 [March 6, 2023](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20230306005169/en/US-FDA-Approves-Intramuscular-Administration-for-Merck%E2%80%99s-MMRV-Family-of-Vaccines-M-M-RII-Measles-Mumps-and-Rubella-Virus-Vaccine-Live-VARIVAX-Varicella-Virus-Vaccine-Live-and-ProQuad-Measles-Mumps-Rubella-and-Varicella-Virus-Vaccine-Live) - Merck announced, "As a pediatrician who routinely vaccinates children, I am excited to now have the option to administer these vaccines intramuscularly," said Dr. Todd Wolynn, co-founding pediatrician of Kids Plus Pediatrics. "This approval provides our practice with an additional route of administration." [July 28, 2022](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220728005295/en/Merck-Announces-Second-Quarter-2022-Financial-Results) - Merck & Co. announced second quarter financial results; Proquad, M-M-R II, and Varivax sales rose by 12% over the same period in 2021. [July 18, 2022](http://outbreaknewstoday.com/measles-vaccination-is-below-target-in-brazil-less-than-50-of-children-have-been-immunized-86532/) - According to the Brazil Ministry of Health, 47.08% of children received the vaccine in 2022. However, the target for vaccination coverage is 95%. [April 27, 2022](https://www.who.int/news/item/27-04-2022-unicef-and-who-warn-of--perfect-storm--of-conditions-for-measles-outbreaks--affecting-children) - The WHO reported 21 large and disruptive measles outbreaks around the world in the last 12 months. Most of the measles cases were reported in Africa and the East Mediterranean region. [March 20, 2022](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/2022/03/20/measles-outbreak-alert-issued-afghanistan) - The U.S. CDC published the [Top 10 Countries](https://www.cdc.gov/globalhealth/measles/data/global-measles-outbreaks.html) with Global Measles Outbreaks in 2021. [March 11, 2022](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7110a5.htm?s_cid=mm7110a5_w) The CDC published: Notes from the Field: Congenital Varicella Syndrome Case — Illinois, 2021. This case reaffirms current Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices recommendations for preventing varicella that all adults be assessed for varicella immunity and that those who do not have evidence of immunity should receive 2 doses of varicella vaccine, with special emphasis for adult groups at high risk, including nonpregnant women of childbearing age. [February 11, 2022](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7106a2.htm?s_cid=mm7106a2_w&utm_source=STAT+Newsletters&utm_campaign=2f794a1bc8-MR_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_8cab1d7961-2f794a1bc8-150521553) - The U.S. CDC's MMWR confirmed 173 (89%) of 194 countries had introduced RCVs by 2020, and 93 (48%) had been verified as having eliminated rubella transmission. [January 27, 2022](https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(21)02004-3/fulltext) - The Lancet published an article that stated: Disrupted vaccination activities during the pandemic increase the potential for another resurgence of measles in the near future. January 3, 2022 - The CDC confirmed a total of [49 measles cases](https://www.cdc.gov/measles/cases-outbreaks.html) were reported by 5 jurisdictions in the U.S. during 2021. This data compares with 2020, when13 individual cases of measles were confirmed in 8 jurisdictions. [October 13, 2021](https://www.cdc.gov/measles/cases-outbreaks.html) - A total of 42 measles cases were reported by three jurisdictions this year. In 2020, the U.S. CDC confirmed 13 individual cases of measles were established in 8 jurisdictions. [July 28, 2021](https://www.gsk.com/media/7124/q2-2021-results-announcement.pdf) - GSK reported financial results. MMRV vaccines sales were flat at AER but grew 6% CER to £54 million, largely driven by favorable phasing in International. [June 30, 2021](https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/watch/measles-africa) - The U.S. CDC reconfirmed various measles outbreaks in Africa. [April 13, 2021](https://www.fda.gov/media/147579/download) - The US FDA issued a letter saying: 'We have approved your request submitted and received on October 21, 2020, to supplement your Biologics License Application (BLA) under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act for Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Virus Vaccine Live (ProQuad) manufactured at the West Point, PA facility to include newly developed US Patient Package Inserts (PPIs) for the refrigerator-stable and frozen formulations of ProQuad and updated US Package Inserts for the refrigerator-stable and frozen formulations of ProQuad that reference the new PPIs.' [April 16, 2021](https://www.fda.gov/vaccines-blood-biologics/vaccines/proquad) - The U.S. FDA updated its Proquad (MMRV) disclosure page. [March 1, 2021](https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/watch/measles-africa) - The U.S. CDC stated that measles continues to be an ongoing risk worldwide. In addition, Africa is reporting measles outbreaks in several countries, meaning they are experiencing a higher number of cases than normal. [September 15, 2020](https://www.fda.gov/media/142224/download) - The US FDA issued a SUPPLEMENT APPROVAL: We have approved your request submitted and received March 16, 2020, to supplement your Biologics License Application (BLA) under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act for Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Virus Vaccine Live (ProQuad) to update the package insert labeling for the refrigerator-stable and frozen formulations to include revisions to Section 5, Warnings and Precautions to state that secondary transmission of varicella vaccine virus (Oka/Merck) can occur between vaccine recipients and contacts susceptible to varicella, including healthy as well as high-risk individuals, leading to disseminated disease. [September 15, 2020](https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/watch/measles-africa) - The U.S. CDC issued a Travel Alert regarding various measles outbreaks across the continent of Africa. [February 9, 2020](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/most-measles-cases-usa-are-related-international-travelers) - The Los Angeles County Department of Public Health (Public Health) confirmed a measles outbreak among five persons. According to an LA Public Health press release, this measles outbreak began when an infectious measles virus international visitor was visiting the greater Los Angeles area. [January 16, 2020](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/pregnant-women-texas-who-are-under-immunized-should-avoid-people-infected-rubella) - Austin Public Health announced investigating a confirmed rubella case, the 1st since 1999. [January 7, 2020](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/pew-survey-found-overwhelming-majority-adults-say-benefits-mmr-vaccine-outweigh-risks) - Pew survey found an overwhelming majority of U.S. adults (88%) say the benefits of the MMR vaccine outweigh the risks, which is about the same share as when Pew measured in 2016. [August 8, 2019](https://www.vaxbeforetravel.com/japan-visitors-should-consider-mmr-or-proquad-rubella-vaccination) - The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) affirmed its Level 2 Travel Alert regarding Japan's ongoing Rubella virus outbreak. [September 6, 2005](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20050906005792/en/FDA-Approves-PROQUAD-Vaccine-U.S.-Protect-Children) - Merck & Co., Inc. announced that the U.S. [FDA](https://www.fda.gov/media/75195/download) had approved the Company's combination vaccine PROQUAD(R) (Measles, Mumps, Rubella, and Varicella measles, mumps, rubella (German measles) and varicella (chickenpox) in children 12 months to 12 years of age. PROQUAD is the first and only vaccine approved in the United States to help protect against these four diseases in a single shot. PROQUAD is also approved for use in children 12 months to 12 years of age if a second dose of measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine is administered. Proquad Vaccine Clinical Trials Proquad vaccine has been involved in over 35 [clinical trials](https://www.clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/results?cond=&term=proquad&cntry=&state=&city=&dist=). In 4 randomized trials in which 5,446 healthy children aged 12 to 23 months received PROQUAD, vaccine response rates for PROQUAD were similar to those induced by the concomitant administration of single doses of M-M-R II and VARIVAX at separate injection sites in 2,038 children. Results showed that following a single dose of PROQUAD, the immune response rates were 97.4 percent for measles, 95.8 to 98.8 percent for mumps, 98.5 percent for rubella, and 91.2 percent for chickenpox. The duration of protection from measles, mumps, rubella, and chickenpox infections after vaccination with PROQUAD is unknown.
